inclusion.criterion: Adolescent (e) consultant for very large size with a demand for growth inhibition
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Very large idiopathic or secondary height without any other etiological treatment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Tanner score ≥ 3 for boys and ≥ 2 for girls
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: A0 ≤ 14 years for boys and ≤ 12.5 years for girls
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Chronological age of 10 to 16 for boys and 8 to 14 for girls
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Actual size from minimum 167.5 cm to 10 years old to at least 180 cm to 16 years old for boys and from minimum 160 cm to 8 years old to at least 174 cm to 14 years old for girls
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Predicted height ≥ 198 cm for boys and ≥ 184 cm for girls (refer to chapter 6.6)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Radiological persistence of tibial and femoral tibial cartilage estimated residual growth ≥ 8 cm
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Absence of psychological contraindication to a curbing treatment of growth
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Agreement of the holders of the parental authority and the teenager for a surgery of epiphysiodesis type
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Agreement of the holders of the parental authority and the teenager to take part in the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Affiliated to a social security scheme
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Very large size related to a medically curable etiology (hypersecretion of growth hormone called acromegaly)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Refusal of the holders of the parental authority or the teenager for a surgery of the epiphysiodesis type
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Refusal of the holders of the parental authority or the teenager to take part in the study
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Medical or psychological contraindication to surgery
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: A 5 months old male brought to the pediatrics surgery clinic with the complaint of empty scrotum at the right side. The baby boy is a first child who was born at the age of 38 weeks with NVD from a healthy mother.
